intro: Ballota foetida var. ampliata, commonly known as the sweet violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its fragrant, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has dark green, heart-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
